m2_convert_encoding package

Submodules

m2_convert_encoding.function_convertEncoding module

This script serves as the functional aspect of this module. It provides two main functions for converting file encodings. The former detects the file’s encoding with the use of the ‘chardet’ library. The latter converts the file into the desired encoding.

Usage: $ python function_convertEncoding.py <sourceFile> -e <outputEncoding> [-o <outputFile>]

Example: $ python function_convertEncoding.py /path/file.txt -e utf-8 -o /path/output/file.txt

m2_convert_encoding.function_convertEncoding.convertEncoding(sourceFile, outputEncoding, outputFile=None)[source]

This function convertS the character encoding of a file.

Parameters:

  • sourceFile (str): Path of the source file.

  • outputEncoding (str): Encoding of the output file.

  • outputFile (str, optional): Path of the output file after the conversion.

Returns:

  • None.

Raises: * FileNotFoundError: If the source file is not found. * Exception: If an error occurs during the conversion.

m2_convert_encoding.function_convertEncoding.detectEncoding(inputFile)[source]

This function detects the character encoding of a file.

Parameters:

  • inputFile (str): Path of the input file.

Returns:

str: Character encoding of the input file.

m2_convert_encoding.gui_convertEncoding module

This script serves as the graphical user interface of this module. This GUI allows users to browse for a file using the ‘Browse’ button, which opens a file dialog to select the input file. It also enables users to choose the desired encoding from a dropdown menu and save the output file in a different directory. Once users have selected their input file and saved it into the desired directory, the conversion will automatically start when the “Convert” button is clicked.

m2_convert_encoding.gui_convertEncoding.browseFile(entryInputFile)[source]

This function opens a file dialog in order to allow users to select the entry file. It also updates the entry widget with the file’s path.

Parameters:

  • entry (str): Path of the entry file.

Returns:

  • None.

m2_convert_encoding.gui_convertEncoding.convertFile(entryInputFile, combo, entryOutputDir)[source]

This function converts the file into a specified character encoding.

Parameters:

  • entryInputFile (ttk.Entry): Entry widget that contains the path of the entry file.

  • combo (ttk.Combobox): Combobox widget that contains a list of the available encodings.

  • entryOutputDir (ttk.Entry): Entry widget that constains the path where the output file will be saved.

Returns:

  • None.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError: If the source file is not found.

  • Exception: If an error occurs during the conversion.

m2_convert_encoding.gui_convertEncoding.createConvertEncodingGui(parent)[source]

This function creates a GUI for selecting and converting a file’s encoding.

Parameters:

  • parent (tkinter.Widget): The parent widget to create the GUI components.

Returns:

  • None.

m2_convert_encoding.gui_convertEncoding.getEncodings()[source]

This function returns a list of encodings.

Returns:

  • list: sorted list of encodings.

m2_convert_encoding.gui_convertEncoding.saveAs(entryOutputDir, entryInputFile)[source]

This function opens a file dialog to select the directory where users are going to save the output file.

Parameters:

  • entryOutputDir (ttk.Entry): Entry widget that contains the path where the output file will be saved.

  • entryInputFile (ttk.Entry): Entry widget that contains the path of the input file.

Returns:

  • None

m2_convert_encoding.gui_convertEncoding.updateEncoding(event, combo)[source]

This function prints the list of sorted encodings into the combobox widget.

Parameters:

  • combo (ttk.Combobox): The combobox widget from which users can select the available encodings.

Returns:

  • None.
